title: Reflective Thinking and Blended Learning Design for Education for Sustainable Development

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental mathematical concepts and general understanding of sustainable development
context.additional_context: Asynchronous Learning Environments with Digital Devices and Continuous Feedback via Formative Assessments

learning_goals: Learners can experience cognitive dissonance while engaging in mathematical modeling of sustainable development issues and perform reflective thinking to resolve it.
Learners can analyze dilemma cases of sustainable development and propose alternative solutions through a blended learning environment (online discussions + offline activities).
Learners can explain a decision-making process based on reflective thinking through self- and peer assessment with over 80% accuracy.

resources: Digital collaboration tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Jamboard)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
